translation.en: [narrator] An extraordinary gathering took place at Israel's Mount Herzl Cemetery
in Jerusalem on September 30th, 2016.
An event unlike any other since the Jewish state's founding in 1948.
translation.ko: 1948년 이스라엘 건국 이래 있었던 다른 어떤 행사와도 달랐죠

translation.en: It included presidents and prime ministers, kings and queens,
religious leaders and international dignitaries.
They had all come to attend the funeral of Shimon Peres,
Israel's ninth president, a three-time prime minister,
a Nobel Peace Prize laureate,
and one of the most respected and beloved elder statesmen in the world.
translation.ko: 세계에서 가장 큰 존경과 사랑을 받은 원로 정치인 중 한 명입니다

translation.en: The day before, thousands upon thousands of Israelis young and old,
translation.ko: 그 전날, 남녀노소를 불문하고 이스라엘 각계각층에서

translation.en: from all walks of life and backgrounds, also paid their respects.
translation.ko: 수만 명의 사람들이 찾아와 조문을 했습니다

translation.en: They had gathered to honor a man
born in a place that few, if any, had ever heard of in Central Europe,
translation.ko: 들어본 사람이 거의 없는 중부 유럽의 어느 지방 출신이며

translation.en: assembled together in a country that did not formally exist
translation.ko: 이들이 모인 곳은 시몬 페레스가 처음 도착했던

translation.en: when Shimon Peres arrived on its shores in 1934.
He was a young firebrand whose visions of the future startled his mentor,
translation.ko: 젊은 선동가였던 페레스의 미래에 대한 비전은 그의 멘토였던

translation.en: Israel's first prime minister, David Ben-Gurion.
translation.ko: 이스라엘 초대 총리 다비드 벤구리온을 놀라게 했죠

translation.en: A sometimes controversial figure on the political scene,
translation.ko: 때로는 정계의 논란을 불러 일으키기도 한 페레스는

translation.en: he was a hawk who built Israel's military and then
he negotiated a peace treaty and became a dove.
translation.ko: 후에는 평화 협정을 타결한 비둘기파가 되었죠

translation.en: Active well into his 90s, Shimon Peres worked not for personal gain,
translation.ko: 90 평생 활발하게 활동한 시몬 페레스는 개인이 아닌 나라의 이익을 위해 일했습니다 건국에 일조했고

translation.en: but to benefit the country he helped to found
translation.ko: 나라의 이익을 위해 일했습니다 건국에 일조했고

translation.en: and loved until the day he passed away.
translation.ko: 죽는 날까지 사랑한 이 나라를 위해서요

translation.en: Shimon Peres was called a dreamer.
There were times when that description was more of a criticism than a compliment,
translation.ko: 그렇게 부르는 데는 칭찬보다 비난의 의미가 더 많았지만

translation.en: but his detractors never stopped him from continuing to dream.
translation.ko: 비난하는 사람들이 그의 꿈을 꺾을 수는 없었습니다

translation.en: People said that I'm a dreamer.
It's true.
But ask me this: What's wrong?
translation.ko: 하지만 전 이렇게 묻죠 그게 어때서요?

translation.en: Who said people who don't dream are right?
translation.ko: 꿈꾸지 않는 사람이 옳다고 누가 그랬죠?

translation.en: [woman 1] The way he lived his life and the choices that he made
translation.ko: 할아버지가 사셨던 방식과 그분이 하셨던 선택은

translation.en: based on a notion that dreams are where it starts, you know,
translation.ko: 우리는 꿈에서 출발해야 한다는 생각에 기초해 있죠

translation.en: dreams and not fantasies.
[man 1] I think a lot of people sometimes found the scale of the vision too utopian,
translation.ko: 많은 이들이 때론 그의 비전이 너무 이상적이라고 했지만

translation.en: but he never meant it to be something that existed only in theory.
For him, it was always about
uniting the theory with a very practical implementation.
translation.ko: 이론을 아주 현실적인 실현 방법과 결합했어요

translation.en: [man 2] Shimon was a man of action.
He did not waste time.
In his vision and as a statesman, he did tremendous things.
translation.ko: 자신의 비전 안에서 정치가로서 엄청난 일들을 해냈죠

translation.en: His original approach to things,
his different approach to things,
he was not like all the others.
He had his own way of thinking.
[man 3] People were always amazed that no matter how old he got,
translation.ko: 사람들은 시몬이 몇 살 때였든 항상 놀라워했죠

translation.en: first, he looked good,
and he stayed young in mind.
Made him young at heart. That's how he kept going.
translation.ko: 마음가짐도 젊었죠 늘 그렇게 살아온 겁니다

translation.en: He was able to just let go of the most unimaginable disappointments
and the deepest frustrations...
and he never gave up on anybody.
[man 4] I think this is the kind of man that teaches that leadership
translation.ko: 리더십이 무엇인지 가르쳐 준 사람이라고 생각해요

translation.en: must be optimistic
and think about how to forge a better tomorrow together.
translation.ko: 더 나은 내일을 다 같이 만들어낼 방법을 생각해야 한다고요

translation.en: He was constantly
working on ways to improve the life of a lot of people.
translation.ko: 많은 이들의 삶을 개선할 방법을 찾기 위해 노력했어요

translation.en: There were discouraging moments,
but never to allow the discouraging moments to...
cause him to retreat from doing what he loved to do.
[man 5] I think that fundamental optimism in him
was something that was why, unlike many people
who seem to fade as they get older,
he seemed to constantly draw more energy and...
translation.ko: 그는 끊임없이 더 많은 에너지를 끌어내고

translation.en: become more of a magnet.
Including among young people,
as he got older,
because he never lost that quality.
[woman 2] He was gifted with the ability to listen to others
translation.ko: 자신과 관점이 다른 사람의 말에도 귀기울일 줄 아는

translation.en: who did not share his views,
and still remain determined to find a path forward.
translation.ko: 앞으로 나아갈 길을 찾겠다는 굳은 결심을 꺾지 않았어요

translation.en: President Peres was all about love and compassion.
translation.ko: 페레스 대통령은 사랑과 연민이 가득한 사람이죠

translation.en: He was a giver, not a taker.
[man 6] My father's life was a journey from an old land to a new land.
translation.ko: 제 아버지의 삶은 구세계에서 신세계로 향하는 여정이었습니다

translation.en: From an old era to a new era.
Inspired by our prophets, he was a harmony of contradictions.
translation.ko: 예언자들에게 영감을 얻어 모순되는 것을 조화롭게 만드셨죠

translation.en: On one hand, very realistic.
On the other hand, a dreamer.
Being an optimist, being positive, using your imagination,
never giving up, always look at the future,
translation.ko: 절대 포기하지 않고 항상 미래를 보셨죠

translation.en: is part of the DNA of his vision.
translation.ko: 이런 것들이 아버지의 비전을 이루는 유전자죠

translation.en: I don't have patience to sit and watch.
I want to be a participant,
and clearly, in the march to the future.
I don't like to sit on my chair
and wait ten years until something new will arrive.
translation.ko: 새로운 일이 일어날 때까지 10년을 기다리고 싶진 않아요

translation.en: I prefer to run, to move, to think, to be surprised.
translation.ko: 저는 달리고 움직이며 생각하고 놀라움을 느끼고 싶어요

translation.en: Always be optimistic, but never be satisfied.
translation.ko: 항상 낙관적으로 생각하되 절대 만족하지 마세요

translation.en: Go ahead.
Dream.
[narrator] Shimon Peres was born Shimon Perski
on August 2nd, 1923, in the town of Vishneva,
then in Poland, now a part of Belarus, close to Lithuania.
translation.ko: 당시엔 폴란드였고 지금은 벨라루스이며 리투아니아에 가깝죠

translation.en: I was an exceptionally large baby.
I was a sensation, if you want.
I almost killed my mother.
And to this very day, I feel apologetic about it.
But once I was born, the doctor checked me and he said:
translation.ko: 그래도 내가 태어났을 때 의사가 절 확인해 보고는 이랬죠

translation.en: "This boy doesn't need anything, no vaccination."
I didn't get a vaccination in my life, you know?
Where I was born...
It was a small shtetl, they called it. Small Jewish village.
Something like a thousand souls, probably.
All of them, without exception, Zionist.
translation.ko: 전부 다 한 명도 빠짐없이 시온주의자였죠

translation.en: And for us, Israel was a dream.
When a package of oranges came from Israel to Vishneva...
translation.ko: 이스라엘에서 보낸 오렌지 상자가 비시네바로 오면

translation.en: it was the greatest event for all of us.
They were beautifully packed
in a sort of a silky Jaffa packing.
And their smell was fantastic.
[narrator] Throughout his childhood in Vishneva,
one of Shimon Peres' biggest influences
translation.ko: 시몬 페레스에게 가장 큰 영향을 미친 사람 중 하나가

translation.en: was his maternal grandfather, Zvi Meltzer.
A disciple of the legendary rabbinical figure, the Vilna Gaon,
he studied and taught at the famed Volozhin Yeshiva.
[Peres] He was a rabbi.
He knew by heart the Bible, the Talmud, all the others,
translation.ko: 성경과 탈무드 같은 것들을 다 외우고 계셨죠

translation.en: but he was also playing the violin.
He took me under his wings.
I think I was the preferred grandchild he has had.
translation.ko: 손주들 중에서 저를 좋아하셨던 거 같아요

translation.en: He started to teach me, at the age, probably, of three or four,
translation.ko: 저를 아마 3, 4살 때부터 가르치기 시작하셨을 거예요

translation.en: every day a page of the Talmud.
He suggested to me to read even Russian literature.
He told me to read The Brothers Karamazov of Dostoyevsky.
There were weeks I couldn't fall asleep, you know?
translation.ko: 몇 주 동안 잠을 못 이뤘어요

translation.en: Imagine a child reading this terrible book.
translation.ko: 아이가 이런 무서운 책을 읽는다고 생각해 보세요

translation.en: [man 2] The second person who very much influenced his early life
translation.ko: 시몬이 어렸을 때 아주 많은 영향을 끼친 두 번째 인물은

translation.en: was his mother Sara.
She was a librarian and she actually instilled into him
translation.ko: 도서관 사서로서 시몬에게 책과 문학에 대한 사랑을

translation.en: the love for books, for literature.
[Peres] She read in three languages:
Russian, Yiddish and Hebrew.
And she taught us the classics of Yiddish and the classics of Hebrew.
translation.ko: 제게 이디시와 히브리 고전을 가르쳐 주셨어요

translation.en: And it was our bread and butter.
[narrator] Following in his grandfather's footsteps,
young Shimon was devoutly religious, far more than his own father.
translation.ko: 어린 시몬은 그의 아버지보다 훨씬 더 종교적으로 독실했습니다

translation.en: You know, in the shtetl,
there wasn't electricity.
My father was well-to-do,
so he brought a radio working on batteries.
[narrator] One Saturday, Shimon returned from the Sabbath prayers
translation.ko: 어느 토요일 시몬이 안식일 기도를 하고 돌아왔더니

translation.en: to find his father listening to the radio.
I became outraged and I broke the radio.
"How dare do you play on a Saturday?"
translation.ko: '어찌 감히 안식일인 토요일에 놀 수가 있어요?'

translation.en: [Michael Bar-Zohar] If you want to understand Shimon's character,
you have to go back to when he was four, five.
He came once to his grandmother's home with another child.
translation.ko: 할머니 집에 다른 아이와 함께 온 적이 있었죠

translation.en: The boy was stocky, strong, much stronger than he was.
translation.ko: 그 아이는 다부지고, 힘센 시몬보다 훨씬 힘센 아이였죠

translation.en: And they played a game,
one was going to throw the other on the ground.
And the other was stronger, so he threw Shimon on the ground.
translation.ko: 다른 아이가 더 힘이 세서 시몬을 쓰러뜨렸죠

translation.en: Shimon got up and said in Yiddish: "An andere mal,"
translation.ko: 시몬은 일어나서 이디시어로 이랬죠, '안 안더레 말'

translation.en: "another time."
So they do the second time.
"An andere mal."
Third time, fourth time.
Finally, the grandmother said, "Shimon, that's enough.
translation.ko: 결국 할머니가 이러신 거예요 '시몬, 그만 하렴'

translation.en: He's stronger than you."
And Shimon said, "No, perhaps next time I'll win."
translation.ko: 그러자 시몬은 이랬죠 '아뇨, 다음엔 제가 이길 거예요'

translation.en: And that's Shimon Peres from then until this very day.
translation.ko: 그게 바로 시몬 페레스의 모습이죠 그때부터 지금까지요

translation.en: "Perhaps next time I'll win."
[narrator] Shimon Perski had a carefree childhood,
translation.ko: 시몬 페르스키는 태평한 어린 시절을 보냈습니다

translation.en: swimming in the Olshansky River that ran behind his house
translation.ko: 집 뒤로 흐르는 올샨스키 강에서 수영을 했죠

translation.en: with his friends and his younger brother Gershon or Gigi, as he became known...
translation.ko: 친구들과 함께, 나중에 '기기'라고 불리게 된 동생 게르숀과 함께요

translation.en: The forests surrounding Vishneva
provided their father, Yitzhak, with a good living as a lumber merchant.
But in the early 1930s, Polish authorities began to levy special taxes
translation.ko: 하지만 1930년대 초에 폴란드 당국은 유대인이란 이유로

translation.en: against Yitzhak Perski's lumber business because he was Jewish.
translation.ko: 이츠하크 페르스키의 목재 사업에 특별세를 부과했습니다

translation.en: It became almost impossible for him to make a living.
In 1932, he decided he had no choice
but to leave Vishneva for Palestine, Eretz Israel,
translation.ko: 에레츠 이스라엘의 팔레스타인으로 갈 수밖에 없었죠

translation.en: where his brother and other family members had already moved.
translation.ko: 그의 형과 다른 가족들은 이미 그곳으로 이사한 상태였습니다

translation.en: He would set up a new lumber business there
and send for his wife Sara and his sons once he was making enough money.
translation.ko: 돈을 충분히 모으면 아내 사라와 아들들을 부르려고 했죠

translation.en: Not long after Yitzhak's departure,
translation.ko: 이츠하크가 떠난 지 얼마 되지 않아

translation.en: a member of the Jewish community was brutally murdered
translation.ko: 유대인 공동체 사람 하나가 잔인하게 살해당했습니다

translation.en: by an anti-Semitic gang in one of the nearby forests.
And there was a picture of him in the papers.
All of us were alarmed.
[narrator] So alarmed that they decided to leave for Palestine as soon as they could.
translation.ko: 너무 놀라서 할 수 있는 한 빨리 팔레스타인으로 떠나기로 했죠

translation.en: A few months later, Shimon, Gigi, and Sara
translation.ko: 몇 달 후, 시몬, 기기, 사라는

translation.en: gathered at the train station outside of Vishneva.
Among those who came to the station to say goodbye
was his grandfather, Zvi Meltzer.
[Peres] He stood aside quietly.
When the locomotive arrived, he came close to me, embraced me,
translation.ko: 기관차가 도착하자 저한테 오셔서 꼭 껴안아 주시고

translation.en: and told me: "My son, I have just one request from you.
Remain Jewish."
He embraced me, and that was the last time I saw him.
translation.ko: 저를 안아 주셨고 그게 할아버지를 본 마지막이었죠

translation.en: [narrator] Sara, Shimon, and Gigi arrived in Jaffa Harbor
via Istanbul in British Mandatory Palestine
in the summer of 1934.
[Peres] It was like arriving in a different planet, you know?
translation.ko: 마치 다른 행성에 온 거 같았죠

translation.en: Nothing was alike in Jaffa and Vishneva.
translation.ko: 야파와 비시네바 사이에는 공통점이 하나도 없었죠

translation.en: My father came with a boat,
because there wasn't a port, with Arab sailors.
But the first sensation was the sky.
translation.ko: 하지만 제일 먼저 놀랐던 건 하늘이었어요

translation.en: I never saw in my life a blue sky, blue, totally blue,
translation.ko: 제 평생 그렇게 파란 정말로 파란 하늘은 처음 봤죠

translation.en: and the sun, so warming,
and the smell of the oranges, which is like perfume.
People were not dressed as heavily as we were.
translation.ko: 우리처럼 두꺼운 옷을 입은 사람이 없었죠

translation.en: They were lightly dressed.
They were sunburned.
They were strong.
And for the first time,
I came to a place where everything was written in Hebrew.
translation.ko: 모든 게 히브리어로 쓰여 있는 곳에 온 거였죠

translation.en: Imagine coming from a place
that you didn't see any Hebrew language
to a place there is only Hebrew languages.
It's like, you know, I was jumping from one world to another world.
translation.ko: 한 세계에서 다른 세계로 점프한 거였죠

translation.en: I couldn't believe it.
I was reborn.
And I was happy.
That I don't have the words to describe it.
My dream came true,
and the dream was by far more beautiful,
translation.ko: 제 어떤 꿈보다 훨씬 더 아름답고

translation.en: more fascinating, more optimistic, more than I ever had dreamed.
[narrator] Shimon enrolls in sixth grade at the Balfour School in Tel Aviv.
He immediately stands out among other students,
but for the wrong reasons.
I knew Hebrew perfectly,
but with the Ashkenazi accent.
So a little bit at the beginning, the students were laughing at me.
[Bar-Zohar] He wanted to be a sabra.
He had an accent from which he didn't get rid until today, actually.
translation.ko: 지금까지도 없애지 못한 그 악센트가 있었거든요

translation.en: And that was the one thing which he didn't like about my biography.
translation.ko: 그 부분이 단 하나 제 전기에서 안 좋았던 부분이라더군요

translation.en: He called me once and he said, "Who told you I have a Polish accent?"
translation.ko: 한번은 저를 부르더니 이러더군요 '내가 폴란드 악센트라고 누가 그랬나?'

translation.en: I said, "Shimon, nobody has to tell me that. I hear it."
translation.ko: 전 그랬죠, '시몬, 누가 얘기 안 해줘도 알죠, 들리는데요'

translation.en: "You hear it! Who told you?"
Then he met a friend whose father convinced him
to go to the agricultural school in Ben Shemen.
And then he saw his life, his future, in agriculture.
translation.ko: 시몬은 그때 농업에서 자신의 인생과 미래를 보았습니다

translation.en: He says once he wanted to be a farmer
or a poet to the stars.
[narrator] "The most important service to the people of Israel
is building the country by working the land,"
writes then 15-year-old Shimon Perski in an essay,
translation.ko: 시몬 페르스키가 15세 때 소논문에 쓴 글입니다

translation.en: "Why I Aspire to Study and Live in Ben Shemen."
"My place is not in the city," he insists,
"but in the village behind the plow, in the field."
He also becomes a leader in one of the most popular
Zionist youth movements in the country,
translation.ko: 시몬은 또한 전국에서 가장 유명한 시온주의자 청년 단체 중 한 곳인

translation.en: HaNoar HaOved, "The Working Youth."
translation.ko: '하누아 하오베드' 즉 '일하는 청년' 의 리더가 되죠

translation.en: Shimon's activism soon brings him to the attention
translation.ko: 시몬의 행동주의는 곧 유대인 기구 의장이자

translation.en: of the chairman of the Jewish Agency, the leader of the Haganah,
translation.ko: 하가나의 대표이며 가장 중요한 노동 시온주의자인

translation.en: and perhaps the most important figure in labor Zionism, David Ben-Gurion.
[Peres] So, one day I got a message from Ben-Gurion
that he would like to meet me.
He was my hero, but I didn't dream to meet him.
translation.ko: 제 영웅이었지만 직접 만나리라곤 꿈도 못 꿨죠

translation.en: And he suggested that I should join him in his car
from Tel Aviv to Haifa.
I was very excited.
It was a winterly day.
I came to his place, and I came in the car.
He fell asleep.
There was no end to my disappointment,
because there was no end to my expectations.
Well, when we came near Haifa,
all of a sudden he opened his eyes, looked at me.
translation.ko: 벤구리온은 갑자기 눈을 뜨고 저를 바라봤어요

translation.en: I'm not sure he knew who I am.
He tried to think, "Who is that young boy here?"
And all of a sudden he says:
"You know, Trotsky was not a great leader."
How did Trotsky enter the car at the last part of our voyage? I don't know.
translation.ko: 어떻게 우리 여행 막바지에 트로츠키가 나왔죠? 저도 몰라요

translation.en: [narrator] Ben-Gurion then proceeded to lecture Shimon
on why Trotsky was not as effective a leader as Lenin
because he was unable to make decisions.
At the end of the sentence, he fell asleep,
translation.ko: 그 말이 끝나자마자 벤구리온은 잠이 들었어요

translation.en: and that was the end of our trip.
During the evening and night,
the Arabs used to shoot at our village.
translation.ko: 아랍인들이 우리 마을에 총을 쏘곤 했어요

translation.en: We were surrounded all around by Arab villages.
translation.ko: 우린 아랍 마을로 다 둘러싸여 있었죠

translation.en: So during the night, I was on the watch.
And that happened to be very near the home of Sonya.
translation.ko: 보초 서던 곳이 소냐의 집과 아주 가까웠어요

translation.en: [narrator] Sonya is the daughter of Ben Shemen's carpentry teacher, Yakov Gelman.
translation.ko: 소냐는 벤 셰멘의 목공 선생 야코프 겔만의 딸이죠

translation.en: [Bar-Zohar] He saw this girl coming out of the house with one of the teachers,
translation.ko: 시몬은 소냐가 선생님 집에서 나오는 걸 봤는데

translation.en: and she had this gorgeous Greek profile,
and she was with short pants,
and he looked at her and he fell in love.
And that was total. He was very much in love.
[narrator] October 1939.
The Nazis invade Poland, and World War II begins.
translation.ko: 나치가 폴란드를 침공하면서 2차 세계 대전이 발발합니다

translation.en: The British government issues a decree known as the White Paper,
translation.ko: "팔레스타인 정책 성명" 영국 정부는 '백서'로 알려진 법령을 발표합니다

translation.en: strictly limiting Jewish immigration to Palestine,
translation.ko: 유대인의 팔레스타인 이주를 엄격하게 제한하는 내용으로

translation.en: making it impossible for Jews to flee Nazi-occupied Europe.
translation.ko: 유대인은 나치가 장악한 유럽을 떠날 수 없게 됩니다

translation.en: David Ben-Gurion proclaims,
"We will help the British as if there were no White Paper,
translation.ko: '우리는 백서가 없는 것처럼 영국을 도와 싸울 것이며'

translation.en: and fight the White Paper as if there were no war."
For this reason, thousands of Jews in Palestine
translation.ko: 이런 이유로 팔레스타인에 사는 수천 명의 유대인은

translation.en: soon enlist in the British Army to fight the Nazis.
translation.ko: 곧 영국군에 입대하여 나치와 싸우게 되죠

translation.en: Among them, Shimon's father Yitzhak, who is soon captured by the Germans.
translation.ko: 시몬의 아버지 이츠하크도 그렇게 입대했다 곧 독일군의 포로가 되죠

translation.en: For most of the war, the family has no idea if he's dead or alive.
translation.ko: 전쟁 기간 내내 가족들은 그의 생사를 모릅니다

translation.en: While some join the Haganah
and its elite fighting division, the Palmach,
to continue resisting the British mandatory authority,
Shimon and many others choose a different path.
translation.ko: 시몬과 많은 다른 사람들은 다른 킬을 택하죠

translation.en: [Bar-Zohar] He didn't want to enlist in the British Army.
There was a slogan in Palestine at that time among the Jews.
translation.ko: 당시 팔레스타인 유대인 사이에선 이런 구호가 있었어요

translation.en: "Some to the arms and some to the land."
And he preferred to build the kibbutz they were creating at the time.
translation.ko: 시몬은 당시에 만들고 있었던 키부츠를 건설하는 게 더 좋았죠

translation.en: Kibbutz Alumot in Galilee.
And that's the time when Sonya, his girlfriend, left him.
translation.ko: 당시에는 시몬의 여자 친구 소냐가 그를 떠난 때였죠

translation.en: She went to British Army.
And he stayed and they separated.
[narrator] January 20th, 1942.
A top secret meeting of high-ranking Nazis is taking place in a villa
translation.ko: 베를린 외곽의 그림 같은 발제 호수에서 수천 킬로 떨어진

translation.en: a few thousand miles away on picturesque Lake Wannsee, outside of Berlin.
translation.ko: 어느 빌라에서 나치 고위급들의 일급 비밀 회의가 열립니다

translation.en: The topic of their discussion:
the implementation of what will soon be called
translation.ko: 곧 '유대인 문제의 최종 해결책'으로 불리게 되는

translation.en: The Final Solution of the Jewish Question.
In just a little over an hour and a half, these Nazi officials
translation.ko: 고작 1시간 반이 넘었을 무렵 이 나치 고관들은

translation.en: formalize the procedures that set up death camps such as
Auschwitz, Treblinka, Sobibor, and Majdanek
translation.ko: 죽음의 수용소를 만들어 수백만의 유럽 유대인을

translation.en: in the systematic murder of millions of European Jews.
Four days later on January 24th,
Shimon leads an expedition of the working youth, which he's organized,
to the ancient fortress of Masada,
the site of the famous First Century Jewish rebellion against the Romans.
translation.ko: 이곳은 1세기에 로마 제국과 맞선 유대 반란 유적지죠

translation.en: The British Mandatory Authority does not want Jews
making pilgrimages to Masada
and has banned Jews from traveling to this area.
translation.ko: 유대인이 이 지역을 여행하는 걸 금지했죠

translation.en: So the group is risking arrest.
translation.ko: 그래서 시몬의 그룹은 체포될 위기에 처합니다

translation.en: Their mission is to rebuild the paths going to the top of Masada,
translation.ko: 그들의 목표는 해발 1,500m 높이의 마사다 성채 꼭대기로

translation.en: 1,500 feet above sea level,
that had been destroyed in an earthquake.
[Peres] We saw some parts of the roads,
and I said: "Look, I think this is the way to the top."
translation.ko: 제가 그랬죠 '이게 정상까지 가는 길일 거야'

translation.en: I started going. I made one curve.
translation.ko: 저는 가기 시작했어요 첫 모퉁이를 돌았죠

translation.en: I found a connection to the other curve.
When I came to the fourth curve, the curve disappeared.
So I was hanging in the middle.
And stones began to fall, and there was a danger to my life.
translation.ko: 돌이 굴러 떨어지기 시작했고요 생명의 위협을 받았죠

translation.en: [narrator] His friends go into action.
They climb to the top of Masada and make a human ladder,
translation.ko: 마사다 정상까지 가서 인간 사다리를 만듭니다

translation.en: each person holding the legs of the other
until the last is able to offer his legs to Shimon.
translation.ko: 마지막 사람의 다리를 시몬이 잡을 수 있을 때까지요

translation.en: And they started to carry me up to the top.
Needless to say that for a day or two I couldn't walk.
translation.ko: 저는 당연히 하루 이틀을 못 걸었죠

translation.en: But there we were sitting and learning what happened in Masada.
translation.ko: 하지만 우리는 앉아서 마사다에서 있었던 일을 공부했죠

translation.en: [narrator] At the very end of their expedition,
the group leaves a parchment scroll for future visitors to see.
translation.ko: 그들은 미래의 방문객을 위해 양피지 두루마리를 남기죠

translation.en: It proclaims, "Masada will never fall again."
translation.ko: 이렇게 썼어요, '마사다는 다시는 함락되지 않을 것이다'

translation.en: Eight months later,
Shimon's beloved grandfather, Reb Zvi Meltzer,
translation.ko: 시몬이 너무나도 사랑하는 할아버지 즈비 멜처가

translation.en: along with his grandmother, his uncle, and the remaining Jews of Vishneva,
translation.ko: 시몬의 할머니, 삼촌 등 비시네바의 유대인들이 다 같이

translation.en: are rounded up and locked inside the shtetl synagogue,
which is then set on fire.
They're all burned alive.
translation.ko: 그 안에 있던 이들은 모두 불타 죽었죠

translation.en: The Perski family will not learn of their fate until after the war's end.
translation.ko: 페르스키 가족은 전쟁이 끝나서야 그들의 운명을 알게 됩니다 "1942년 8월 30일 비시네보의 유대인들이"

translation.en: Shimon quickly becomes a leader at Alumot,
the kibbutz he and his friends are building
on a mountain overlooking the Galilee.
translation.ko: 갈릴리를 굽어보는 산 위에 있는 곳이죠

translation.en: He is elected general secretary and then treasurer.
translation.ko: 시몬은 총서기로 뽑혔고 이후에는 회계를 맡습니다

translation.en: Shimon Perski also becomes a rising star in the youth movement of Mapai,
translation.ko: 시몬 페르스키는 또한 마파이 청년 운동의 떠오르는 스타가 되죠

translation.en: the labor party faction under Ben-Gurion's leadership.
He's given an old Triumph motorcycle so he can travel in the Jezreel Valley,
translation.ko: 트라이엄프 오토바이를 받은 그는 제즈릴 계곡을 다니며

translation.en: recruiting new members,
and spend two days a week in Tel Aviv conferring with party leaders.
translation.ko: 일주일에 이틀은 텔아비브에서 당 지도부와 회의를 하죠

translation.en: At the beginning of 1945,
David Ben-Gurion gives him a special assignment:
translation.ko: 다비드 벤구리온은 시몬에게 특별한 임무를 부여합니다

translation.en: mapping and exploring the Negev Desert all the way down to Eilat,
translation.ko: 엘리앗까지 네게브 사막을 탐사하여 지도를 만들라는 거죠

translation.en: looking ahead to it becoming part of a future Jewish state.
translation.ko: 장래에 세워질 이스라엘의 땅이 되리라 예상하면서요

translation.en: And when we were going, we saw in a very high tree an eagle.
translation.ko: 그때 아주 높은 나무에서 독수리를 봤어요

translation.en: I saw it and immediately climbed the tree.
Its Hebrew name is "Peres."
It was there where I changed my name.
[narrator] Not long after the now Shimon Peres returns to Alumot,
translation.ko: 알루못으로 돌아온 지 얼마 지나지 않아

translation.en: a special guest arrives at the kibbutz.
Sonya, who has finished her British Army service.
He remained in touch with her over the years,
writing letters about Alumot
and the life they were building in the Galilee.
He never gave up hope that they might reunite
translation.ko: 시몬은 두 사람이 다시 만날 거란 희망을 잃지 않았고

translation.en: and invited her to visit.
The two fall deeply in love once again and resume their relationship.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 또 한번 깊이 사랑에 빠져 다시 사귀게 됩니다

translation.en: [Peres] May the 1st... supposed to be the last day of war, 1945.
And Sonya and myself decided to get married.
In the kibbutz, it was in the open air.
There were hundreds of people coming over from the vicinity.
Kibbutzim and moshavim.
And we were happy.
[narrator] Their honeymoon consists of a few nights down the hill from Alumot,
translation.ko: 신혼 여행으로는 알루못이 있는 언덕 아래, 요르단강 기슭에

translation.en: on the banks of the Jordan River
in a tent set up as a gift by their fellow kibbutzniks.
translation.ko: 결혼 선물로 만들어 준 텐트에서 며칠을 보냈죠

translation.en: Missing from the wedding party is Shimon's father Yitzhak,
translation.ko: 결혼 파티에 참석 못 한 시몬의 아버지 이츠하크는

translation.en: who's been found alive in Europe at the war's end
translation.ko: 전쟁이 끝나고 유럽에 생존해 있음이 확인되죠

translation.en: after escaping several German POW camps.
translation.ko: 독일 포로 수용소 몇 군데를 탈출한 뒤였습니다

translation.en: He is stuck in England
and would return as Sonya and Shimon's honeymoon was ending.
translation.ko: 소냐와 시몬이 신혼 여행을 마칠 때쯤 돌아옵니다

translation.en: In the summer of 1946, Shimon becomes a new father
as Sonya gives birth to their daughter Zvia,
who they nickname Zviki.
A few months later,
David Ben-Gurion summons Shimon to Haganah headquarters in Tel Aviv.
translation.ko: 다비드 벤구리온이 시몬을 텔아비브 하가나 본부로 부르죠

translation.en: The Jewish agency head wants a young man with his leadership skills on staff.
translation.ko: 유대인 기구의 수장은 리더십 있는 젊은 친구를 원합니다

translation.en: [Peres] And they promised it will be for a year's time.
And I had my... still, my Triumph.
And I was Triumphing on Fridays back home.
translation.ko: 저는 주말에 그걸 타고 집으로 돌아갔죠

translation.en: But this year lasted 20 years.
[narrator] May 14th, 1948.
Great Britain ends its mandate in Palestine,
six months after the United Nations passes a resolution
translation.ko: 6개월 후 국제 연합은 다음과 같은 결의를 통과시킵니다

translation.en: declaring two states in the territory, one Jewish and one Arab.
translation.ko: 팔레스타인에 유대 국가과 아랍 국가를 하나씩 세운다는 거죠

translation.en: It also withdraws its troops.
The Jews accept the resolution, the Arabs do not.
translation.ko: 유대인은 결의를 받아들이지만 아랍인은 그렇지 않죠

translation.en: Later that day, the Jewish People's Council assembles
and declares the establishment of a Jewish state to be called Israel,
with its capital in Jerusalem.
In the days leading up to these events,
David Ben-Gurion summons Shimon Peres to his office.
translation.ko: 다비드 벤구리온은 시몬 페레스를 자기 집무실로 호출합니다

translation.en: [Peres] Ben-Gurion said:
"We are going to have a war."
And then he took out a piece of paper from his jacket, from his pocket,
translation.ko: 재킷 주머니에서 종이를 한 장 꺼내줬는데

translation.en: and he gave me a list, how many rifles we have, how many...
translation.ko: 우리가 보유한 소총이 몇 자루인지 등이 쓰여 있는 목록이었죠

translation.en: He says: "With that, we shall lose the war.
Go and do everything you can.
translation.ko: '할 수 있는 건 다 해 보게'

translation.en: Smuggle, steal, produce, buy.
Everything is permitted."
[narrator] May 15th the following day, as Ben-Gurion has predicted,
the Arab League declares war and attacks the new Jewish state.
translation.ko: 아랍 연맹은 신생 이스라엘과 전쟁을 선포하고 침공하죠

translation.en: [Peres] To our great surprise,
the United States, Great Britain and France
decided to put an embargo on arms against the Middle East,
translation.ko: 중동에 대한 무기 금수 조치를 결정했지만

translation.en: but the Russians weren't part of it,
so the Arabs continued to get arms, and we were alone.
translation.ko: 그래서 아랍인들은 무기를 계속 들여왔고 우린 고립됐죠

translation.en: [narrator] As the war rages,
Shimon Peres becomes one of the key people responsible for ensuring
translation.ko: 시몬 페레스는 이스라엘 방위군의 무기 확보를 담당하는

translation.en: that the Israel Defense Forces have the weaponry it needs.
translation.ko: 주요 인물 중 한 명이 됐죠

translation.en: [Bar-Zohar] They went all over the world to buy weapons,
to buy planes, even junk,
but everything which could shoot or could be used as a weapon.
translation.ko: 발사가 되거나 무기로 쓸 수 있으면 뭐든 샀습니다

translation.en: They bought in South America,
they bought in Africa, they bought all over in Europe.
And they concentrated all these weapons in secret bases
translation.ko: 이 모든 무기를 비밀 기지에 모아 두었습니다

translation.en: in France, in Corsica, Italy, and Greece.
[narrator] Despite the arms embargo,
and Israel's numerical disadvantage fighting its Arab neighbors,
the Jewish state emerges victorious
by the time a truce is negotiated to end the war in 1949.
Shimon has been promoted to the position of
assistant secretary of defense for naval affairs.
He's only 26 years old.
Yet despite everything he has done to obtain arms
translation.ko: 하지만 이스라엘의 존립을 위해 무기를 구하려는

translation.en: to ensure Israel's existence,
he finds himself being criticized by many of his peers.
Unlike them, he has never become a soldier,
translation.ko: 그들과는 달리, 시몬은 군인이 되지 않았습니다

translation.en: although he did decline a commission as a colonel
directly from the Army's chief of staff.
I told him: "Look.
Today, I'm a private. You'll make me a colonel,
translation.ko: '지금 전 사병입니다 총장님이 절 대령으로 임명하시면'

translation.en: I have to salute this... And he will salute me,
translation.ko: '전 이렇게 경례해야겠죠 다른 사람도 제게 경례할 거고요'

translation.en: and I shall spend time on ceremonies,
and I don't need it."
[Bar-Zohar] Shimon was actually much more important than a soldier and even than a colonel.
translation.ko: 시몬은 일개 사병이나 대령보다도 훨씬 더 중요했어요

translation.en: He worked with Ben-Gurion, Eshkol, and bought weapons,
translation.ko: 그는 벤구리온, 에시콜과 함께 무기를 사들였고

translation.en: and planned the conquest of the Negev,
and was the deputy chief of the Navy.
Because he was doing such an important job,
he didn't think it was important to wear a uniform.
translation.ko: 제복을 입는 게 중요하지 않다고 생각했습니다

translation.en: The fact is that if he had just worn a uniform during the war,
translation.ko: 사실 그가 전쟁 중에 군복을 입기만 했으면

translation.en: his political career would have been ten-fold easier.
[narrator] In the months following the war's end,
translation.ko: 전쟁이 끝난 후 여러 달 동안

translation.en: as Shimon Peres continues the search for weapons
in the face of the international arms embargo,
he finds himself very frustrated.
He feels constrained by his lack of education.
translation.ko: 배움이 부족한 데서 나오는 제약을 느낀 거죠

translation.en: He has a high rank in the Defense Ministry,
yet he doesn't even have a high school diploma.
[Peres] I came to Ben-Gurion and I said: "Look.
I am ashamed to tell you, but you should know.
I don't know a single word in English."
[Bar-Zohar] And Ben-Gurion said, "Very well. I'll send you to New York
translation.ko: 그러자 벤구리온은 이랬죠 '잘됐어, 자넬 뉴욕으로 보내주지'

translation.en: where we have our special mission of producing weapons for Israel.
translation.ko: '거기서 이스라엘 무기를 제조하는 특별 임무가 진행 중이야'

translation.en: Most of them illegal, by the way.
And you're going to be deputy director of this mission
and later you'll take over."
[narrator] Sonya, Shimon, and Zviki move into an apartment
on the corner of 95th Street and Riverside Drive
on the Upper West side of New York City.
While he takes classes at The New School for social research

translation.en: almost since the crisis began,
but their initial ideas have been quickly rejected by Rabin as not feasible.
translation.ko: 하지만 처음 발상은 라빈이 실현 불가능하다며 거절했습니다

translation.en: In the meantime, a group of young officers organized themselves,
translation.ko: 그 사이에 스스로 자원한 젊은 장교들이

translation.en: said they had an idea of their own.
I saw the boys.
Unbelievable. Courageous. Wise. Experienced.
translation.ko: 그 친구들을 봤더니 굉장한 거예요 용기 있고 현명하며 경험이 풍부했죠

translation.en: And they say it's possible.
I went to the prime minister.
I said: "I would like to try to work with this group of people
and see if we can find a solution."
[narrator] But Rabin is still skeptical.
Shimon Peres, Motta Gur, and their special team
translation.ko: 시몬 페레스, 모타 구르 그리고 그들의 특별 부대는

translation.en: go into high gear to finalize a military plan
translation.ko: 군사 작전 계획을 마무리하기 위해 사력을 다하고

translation.en: that will meet with Prime Minister Rabin's approval.
translation.ko: 결국 라빈 총리의 승인을 얻게 되죠

translation.en: Twenty-four hours later, a viable course of action is coming together.
That Sunday, July 4,
the IDF will fly in an elite force of commandos to Uganda,
translation.ko: 이스라엘 방위군은 정예 특공대를 우간다로 보냅니다

translation.en: as Idi Amin will be out of the country at a conference of African states.
translation.ko: 이디 아민이 아프리카 국가들의 회의에 참석한 틈을 타서요

translation.en: Hercules troop carriers
will fly from Israel and land in Entebbe
as if Idi Amin is returning home from the conference he's been attending.
translation.ko: 이디 아민이 회의 참석을 마치고 돌아온 것처럼요

translation.en: A black Mercedes limousine exactly like Amin's
translation.ko: 이디 아민의 것과 똑같은 검은 벤츠 리무진이

translation.en: will then drive out of one of the Hercules
with an Israeli soldier inside disguised to look like the dictator,
translation.ko: 그 안에는 이디 아민으로 변장한 이스라엘 군인 한 명과

translation.en: surrounded by elite Israeli commandos,
also made up to look like Ugandan soldiers.
translation.ko: 그들도 우간다 군인처럼 보이도록 꾸민 상태로요

translation.en: The commandos will then take the hijackers by surprise, overpower them,
and rescue the hostages,
getting them on the Hercules and spiriting them back to Israel.
translation.ko: 허큘리스 수송기에 태워 이스라엘로 데려오는 겁니다

translation.en: On Saturday morning, July 3,
Chief of Staff Gur phones Peres to report that
translation.ko: 참모 총장 구르는 페레스에게 전화로 이렇게 보고하죠

translation.en: an airborne run-through with the Hercules planes has succeeded.
translation.ko: 허큘리스 수송기를 이용한 공수 훈련에 성공했다고요

translation.en: [Peres] That impressed Rabin.
And we decided we do it.
[narrator] Peres and Gur make their way to the airfield in Tel Aviv,
translation.ko: 페레스와 구르는 텔아비브에 있는 비행장으로 갑니다

translation.en: where the planes and soldiers are getting ready for the mission.
translation.ko: 그곳에서는 항공기와 군인들이 작전을 준비하고 있었습니다

translation.en: The lead commando, 30-year-old Yonatan Netanyahu,
approaches Peres and shakes his hand,
stating that the plan is 100 percent.
Shimon embraces him.
And then he, along with the rest of the commandos,
board the planes and leave on their mission.
[reporter] It was one week almost to the minute
after they'd taken off on their ill-fated flight to Paris,
translation.ko: 이륙한 지 거의 정확히 일주일 만에

translation.en: that the crew and remaining passengers landed back on Israeli soil.
translation.ko: 승무원과 나머지 승객들이 이스라엘 땅에 돌아왔습니다

translation.en: It was, coincidentally, at the exact hour
at which the hijackers' ultimatum to the Israeli government was due to run out,
translation.ko: 납치범들이 이스라엘 정부에 보낸 최후통첩 시한이었습니다

translation.en: and the hostages had been warned by their captors that they would die.
translation.ko: 인질들은 인질범들에게 다 죽을 거라는 얘기를 들었죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] What made you think that Israel could pull off an operation like this?
translation.ko: 어떻게 이스라엘이 이런 작전을 성공할 수 있다고 생각하셨나요?

translation.en: The alternative.
[Peres] People attribute much to luck.
Luck is important.
But what we call luck is actually courage.
translation.ko: 하지만 우리가 운이라고 부르는 건 사실 용기예요

translation.en: You have to take risks,
and you cannot say,
"The risk I'm taking is to have luck."
You have to prepare very carefully
that you will not depend upon the luck.
[narrator] While the Hercules are in the air
and the commandos are on the ground in Entebbie,
the entire operation unfolds in complete radio silence.
[Peres] And on Saturday night,
the silence was broken.
The Chief of Staff Motta, called me up and said:
translation.ko: 모타 참모 총장이 제게 전화해서 이랬죠

translation.en: "We lost one of our fighters."
And that was Yoni Netanyahu.
I almost cried.
But what can I do?
The father of Yoni came to me and he said:
"I have one request.
I want that you will eulogize him."
[Peres in Hebrew] Thanks to the few, many have been saved.
translation.ko: 몇 명의 노력으로 많은 사람을 구했습니다

translation.en: And thanks to the one fallen,
translation.ko: 그리고 목숨을 잃은 한 사람 덕분에

translation.en: new stature has been revived.
And about him, and them,
it can be said in the words of King David:
translation.ko: 다윗 왕의 말을 빌려 이렇게 말할 수 있습니다

translation.en: "Swifter than eagles, stronger than lions, Yonatan on the altar has fallen."
translation.ko: '독수리보다 빠르고 사자보다 용맹한 제단 위의 요나탄이여'

translation.en: I am sorry for you, my brother Yonatan.
You were to me very pleasant. Your love was wonderful.
translation.ko: 자네 때문에 정말 기뻤어 자네의 사랑은 놀라웠지

translation.en: [man 7] I first met Shimon at my brother's funeral,
translation.ko: 제 형의 장례식에서 시몬을 처음 봤죠

translation.en: at my brother's grave, when he delivered this inspiring eulogy.
translation.ko: 형의 무덤에서 영감 가득한 추도사를 했을 때요

translation.en: He spoke about him in such... moving terms and also in historical terms that...
translation.ko: 시몬은 감동적이면서 역사적인 단어로 형에 대해 이야기했죠

translation.en: it just mesmerized me and my family.
translation.ko: "베냐민 네타냐후 이스라엘 총리" 저와 우리 가족의 마음을 사로잡았습니다

translation.en: And that created a bond that lasted throughout the rest of Shimon's life
translation.ko: 그 일로 시몬과 남은 평생 동안 유대감을 갖게 됐어요

translation.en: and which I never forgot. Never.
[Bar-Zohar] All the credit for the Entebbe operation goes to Shimon, not anybody else.
translation.ko: 엔테베 작전은 다른 사람이 아니라 시몬의 공입니다

translation.en: And that were the words of the Chief of Staff of the Army Motta Gur.
translation.ko: 당시 육군 참모 총장 모타 구르가 한 말이었죠

translation.en: The night of the raid, said: "All the credit must go to somebody,
translation.ko: 습격하던 날 밤, 이렇게 말했어요 '모든 공을 돌려야 할 사람은'

translation.en: to one man who pushed up and pushed down, and did not rest,
translation.ko: '작전을 독려하고 반발을 누르면서 이 작전이 성공할 때까지'

translation.en: and did not stop until he achieved this operation,
translation.ko: '쉬지도 않고 멈추지도 않은 단 한 사람'

translation.en: and this is the Minister of Defense, and we owe him all the credit for that."
[narrator] April 1977.
Prime Minister Rabin shocks the nation,
resigning after the news of a financial scandal
translation.ko: 금융 스캔들에 관한 뉴스가 나온 후 사임하면서요

translation.en: involving an illegal foreign bank account belonging to his wife Leah.
translation.ko: 그의 아내 레아가 보유한 외국의 불법 은행 계좌에 관한 소식이었죠

translation.en: Shimon Peres becomes acting prime minister
and is selected as the Labor Party's candidate
for the election scheduled five weeks later.
Running against him is the perennial leader of the opposition,
Likud Party head, Menachem Begin,
who many initially give little chance of defeating Peres.
translation.ko: 처음에는 그가 페레스를 이길 가능성이 많지 않았습니다

translation.en: However, a series of other corruption scandals within the Labor Party
translation.ko: 그러나 노동당 내의 다른 부패 스캔들이 연이어 터지면서

translation.en: also begin dominating the news.
Shimon soon finds himself fighting an uphill battle.
translation.ko: 시몬은 곧 힘겨운 싸움을 하게 됩니다

translation.en: [in Hebrew] Well... it seems... No less than an upheaval.
[narrator] Begin outpolls Peres by almost nine percent of the electorate,
translation.ko: 베긴은 페레스보다 9% 더 많은 유권자의 지지를 얻죠

translation.en: ending three decades of Labor Party rule in the Knesset,
and the Prime Minister's Office.
It is a humiliating defeat for Shimon.
Shimon Peres buries his disappointment over losing the Prime Minister's Office
to Menachem Begin
by becoming a vociferous leader of the opposition in the Knesset.
This is especially the case during the 1982 Lebanon War,
which becomes one of the most controversial in Israel's history.
translation.ko: 이 전쟁은 이스라엘 역사에서 가장 논란이 많은 사건 중 하나죠

translation.en: [Peres] We were attacked from Lebanon
by the PLO and Hezbollah.
Most of the attacks were done by mortars at the range of 40 kilometers.
Begin told me that we will not go further than 40 kilometers,
translation.ko: 베긴은 제게 박격포 사거리 40km 이상은 들어가지

translation.en: the range of the mortars.
It won't take more than four days.
I told him: "Look, if it's four days, 40 kilometers,
and if the purpose is to bring an end to the attacks upon us, I'm for it."
[narrator] Peres travels to the battle zone
translation.ko: 페레스는 전쟁 지역으로 갑니다 군대와 이번 군사 작전의 목적을

translation.en: as a show of support for the troops and the aims of the mission.
translation.ko: 페레스는 전쟁 지역으로 갑니다 군대와 이번 군사 작전의 목적을 지지한다는 걸 보여주려고요

translation.en: He visits his son Chemi, a helicopter pilot
translation.ko: 헬기 조종사인 아들 헤미를 방문하기도 했어요

translation.en: flying in some of the heaviest battles of the war in Damour,
translation.ko: 헤미는 레바논의 주요 테러리스트 기지 중 하나인

translation.en: one of the main terrorist bases in Lebanon.
But as Operation Peace for Galilee expands to bombing Beirut,
translation.ko: 하지만 갈릴리 평화 작전은 베이루트 폭격으로까지 이어지죠

translation.en: Peres' views begin to change.
He becomes one of its most vocal opponents,
even clashing with Yitzhak Rabin,
who supported the siege against the PLO in Beirut.
Public opinion also begins turning against the war
translation.ko: 여론 역시 전쟁에 반대하는 쪽으로 흐르기 시작하죠

translation.en: after Israel is blamed for a Christian militias' massacre
translation.ko: 이스라엘이 베이루트 외곽 팔레스타인 난민 캠프 2곳에서

translation.en: at two Palestinian refugee camps outside of Beirut.
This leads to an Israeli government inquiry
translation.ko: 이 사건은 이스라엘 정부의 조사로 이어지고

translation.en: and the resignation of Ariel Sharon as defense minister.
translation.ko: 아리엘 샤론 국방부 장관이 사임하게 됩니다

translation.en: Emotionally and physically drained by what has become a disaster in Lebanon,
translation.ko: 레바논 전쟁이 재난이 되면서 정서적, 육체적으로 진이 빠지고

translation.en: and then the death of his wife Aliza,
Menachem Begin resigns as prime minister in September of 1983.
His successor is the new head of the Likud, Yitzhak Shamir.
translation.ko: 그의 후계자로 새롭게 리쿠드당 대표가 된 이는 이츠하크 샤미르죠

translation.en: The former leader of the Stern Gang,
one of the most extreme pre-Israel underground movements,
translation.ko: 이스라엘 이전에 있었던 가장 극단적인 투쟁 단체였죠

translation.en: he also opposed the Camp David Accords
from the time of Anwar Sadat's historic visit to Jerusalem in 1977.
translation.ko: 이는 1977년 안와르 사다트가 예루살렘에 와서 체결한 협정이죠

translation.en: Known for being a man of few words,
Shamir is not a skilled politician like his predecessor,
and he soon finds himself overwhelmed
by the myriad of problems Israel is facing:
translation.ko: 문제가 무수히 많다는 걸 알게 되죠

translation.en: the continuing war in Lebanon,
the deepening tensions with the Palestinians,
and an out-of-control inflation rate
that's threatening to destroy the economy.
July 1984. New elections are called, Labor emerges the victor.
[Peres] I got 44 mandates.
The Likud, headed by Shamir, had 41.
I had a majority.
But I didn't have a majority to build a government without him.
translation.ko: 하지만 샤미르를 빼고 단독 정부를 구성할 순 없었죠

translation.en: So we suggested: "Let's have a government based on rotation."
For the first 25 months of this national unity government,
translation.ko: 이 거국 연립 정권은 첫 25개월 동안

translation.en: Shimon Peres will serve as prime minister,
and Yitzhak Shamir will be deputy prime minister and foreign minister.
translation.ko: 이츠하크 샤미르가 부총리 겸 외무부 장관을 맡습니다

translation.en: The subsequent 25 months, the positions will be reversed.
[in Hebrew] All the best. Go get some rest. It's time, after all.
translation.ko: 수고했어요, 좀 쉬어요 이제 시간 됐어요

translation.en: Well, I have two years for that.
[narrator] Shimon Peres is formally sworn in as prime minister on September 13, 1984.
After fulfilling his first campaign promise,
to withdraw Israel's troops from Lebanon,
Prime Minister Peres takes on Israel's disastrous economy.
translation.ko: 페레스 총리는 이스라엘의 처참한 경제를 떠맡죠

translation.en: The country's inflation rate is one of the highest in the world
translation.ko: 이스라엘의 물가 상승률은 세계에서 제일 높은 수준입니다

translation.en: with some economists warning Peres that it could surpass 1,000 percent.
translation.ko: 어떤 경제학자는 페레스에게 1,000%를 넘을 거라고 경고합니다

translation.en: Investors are fleeing the country's industries.
Prices in Israeli stores are being raised every day.
translation.ko: 이스라엘 상점의 물건 가격은 날마다 오릅니다

translation.en: I'd like to see how you're able to provide for a family of four or six people!
translation.ko: 당신들이 4인에서 6인 가족을 어떻게 먹여 살릴지 보고 싶군요!

translation.en: Peres brings together a task force of scholars and economists
translation.ko: 페레스는 학자와 경제학자로 태스크 포스를 만듭니다

translation.en: which devises a plan that involves severe cutbacks
translation.ko: 사회의 모든 부문에서 상당한 지출 삭감 계획을

translation.en: from every sector of society.
[Peres] I called in a Cabinet session
that lasted for 36 hours.
And I cut from everybody.
And I cut 500 million dollars from Defense.
That was the largest cut in the history of Israel.
translation.ko: 이스라엘 역사상 가장 많이 삭감한 것이었죠

translation.en: Then I cut from Education.
The minister of Education was my best friend.
It was the end of the friendship.
All ministers agreed to the cuts of other ministries.
translation.ko: 장관들은 모두 다른 부서 예산 삭감에는 동의했어요

translation.en: None of them agreed to cut his own ministry.
But I said: "Gentlemen, either you take it or I leave you."
translation.ko: 하지만 전 이랬어요, '여러분이 안 받아들이면 내가 물러나겠소'

translation.en: In 36 hours, whoever closed his eyes for a moment, I cut his budget.
translation.ko: 36시간 동안 아무도 눈을 못 붙였죠, 제가 삭감할까 봐요

translation.en: I was criticized from one end to the other end.
But to my great surprise, the tougher I was,
translation.ko: 하지만 제가 놀랐던 건 제가 강하게 하면 할수록

translation.en: the more insistent I became,
I noticed there is a change in the public opinion.
Day to day, my polls went up,
contrary to all of the predictions.
In a matter of six weeks, the inflation started to go down.
[narrator] Israel's inflation rate drops from almost 500% a year to 16%.
Prime Minister Peres' approval rating surpasses 70%,
the highest ever recorded.
He's due to swap roles in October 1986 with Deputy Prime Minister Shamir.
translation.ko: 1986년 10월에 부총리 샤미르와 자리를 바꿀 때가 됩니다

translation.en: [Bar-Zohar] And there were some people, including yours truly,
would try to influence him to break the rotation,
translation.ko: 총리 자리를 바꾸는 약속을 지키지 말라는 조언을 했어요

translation.en: to go for new elections.
He was so popular. It was 80% popularity.
Stop it! Go to elections!
I told them: "Gentlemen, I gave my word.
I'm not going to change."
I knew, from experience and otherwise,
if you don't keep your promises, you will never be a leader.
translation.ko: 만약 약속을 지키지 않는다면 지도자가 될 수 없다고요

translation.en: [narrator] On October 20, 1986,
Yitzhak Shamir is sworn in as prime minister.
Shimon Peres becomes deputy prime minister and foreign minister,
translation.ko: 시몬 페레스는 부총리와 외무부 장관이 됩니다

translation.en: and he quickly focuses on a new goal,
translation.ko: 그리고 재빨리 다른 목표에 초점을 맞추죠

translation.en: a peace treaty with Jordan,
and with King Hussein's assistance,
a solution to the ongoing conflict with the Palestinians.
translation.ko: 팔레스타인과의 끊임없는 분쟁에 대한 해결책을 내는 것입니다

translation.en: [Peres] What was the idea?
That we shall have three entities:
The Jordanian Kingdom, the State of Israel,
and the West Bank that was under the Jordanian rule.
translation.ko: 요르단 지배 하에 있는 서안 지구요

translation.en: The West Bank will be not really completely independent,
translation.ko: 서안 지구는 사실 완전히 독립하는 건 아니고요

translation.en: The Jordanian king and our government
will manage together the West Bank.
Whoever lives in all those places,
if he's Israeli, he will vote for the Israeli Parliament.
If he's a Jordanian, he'll vote for the Jordanian Kingdom.
translation.ko: 요르단 사람이면 요르단 왕국에 투표하는 거죠

translation.en: Everybody can move to wherever he wants.
translation.ko: 모두가 원하는 곳으로 갈 수 있는 겁니다

translation.en: There wouldn't be any problem of settlements,
there wouldn't be any problem about holy places,
because it's open.
[narrator] In a historic speech to the General Assembly of the United Nations,
Shimon Peres offers to enter into direct negotiations with the Hashemite Kingdom.
translation.ko: 시몬 페레스는 요르단 하시미테 왕국에 직접 협상을 제안하죠

translation.en: The speech is received positively and initiates a secret dialogue
translation.ko: 이 연설은 긍정적인 반응을 얻어 후세인 국왕과 페레스는

translation.en: between King Hussein and Peres, supported by the United States.
translation.ko: 미국의 지원 하에 비밀 대화를 시작합니다

translation.en: April 1987.
The king and Shimon Peres are on their way to a clandestine meeting in London.
translation.ko: 후세인 국왕과 시몬 페레스는 런던에서 비밀 회담을 갖죠

translation.en: Prime Minister Shamir refuses to take the meeting seriously.
"Why is Shimon doing this?" he remarks. "Nothing will come of it."
translation.ko: '시몬은 왜 이러는 거죠? 아무 성과도 없을 겁니다'

translation.en: The meeting is facilitated by a prominent member
translation.ko: 회담은 런던 유대인 공동체의 유력 인사인

translation.en: of London's Jewish community, Victor Mishcon,

They say it was the largest gathering...
and young people,
and enthusiastic.
And they shouted: "Rabin! Rabin! Rabin!"

translation.ko: 우리 두 사람은 서로 오랫동안 알고 지냈죠

translation.en: He never embraced me.
translation.ko: 라빈은 절 안아 준 적이 없어요

translation.en: I never heard him sing.
And there he was embracing, happy, singing.
That was his happiest day in his life.
[narrator] When the rally ends, Rabin and Peres leave for their cars.
translation.ko: 집회가 끝나고 라빈과 페레스는 각자 차로 돌아갑니다

and I heard the shots.
And all of a sudden, the security people
pushed me in the car.

translation.ko: 경호원 중 하나가 이러더군요 '총리님은 병원으로 옮겼습니다'

and then he whispered,
he says:

translation.en: Our relations at the last days were really brilliant.

translation.ko: 그때가 제 인생에서 가장 외로웠던 때예요

translation.en: [narrator] A new series of terrorist attacks starting in February 1996

in five separate incidents in Jerusalem and Tel Aviv,

The worst is a suicide bombing on crowded Dizengoff Street
translation.ko: 최악의 사건은 인파가 몰린 텔아비브 중심가 디젠고프가에서

he becomes the youngest prime minister in Israel's history.

translation.ko: 시몬 페레스는 이제 의회의 야당 지도자로 물러나죠

translation.ko: 밤에는 비비가 차를 보내 시몬을 예루살렘의 자기 집으로 모셨죠

translation.ko: 두 사람은 밤마다 같이 시간을 보냈어요

translation.en: Shimon instructing Bibi how to deal with the Palestinians,
translation.ko: 시몬은 비비에게 팔레스타인을 어떻게 다룰지 가르쳤죠

translation.en: how to speak with Arafat.

translation.ko: 오랜 경험과 팔레스타인과의 평화 협상이 바탕이 됐습니다

translation.ko: 에제르 바이츠만 대통령이 임기가 끝나기 전에 사임합니다

translation.en: Shimon Peres emerges as the leading candidate to take his place.
translation.ko: 시몬 페레스는 그의 자리를 대신할 유력한 후보로 떠오르죠

translation.en: Plans are being made for an inauguration celebration.

several lawmakers who pledged their support for Peres
switch their allegiance to his opponent,

translation.ko: 이스라엘 밖에서는 별로 안 유명한 모셰 카차브가 대통령이 됩니다

translation.ko: 거의 더블 스코어로 이기고 이스라엘 11대 총리가 되죠

translation.ko: 리쿠드당과 그의 우파 연정 파트너들은 공공연히 저항합니다

translation.ko: 시몬 페레스는 철수 선언을 지지한다고 밝힙니다

translation.ko: 우리는 많은 부분 서로 의견이 달랐죠

translation.ko: 그는 저를 신뢰했고 저도 그를 좋아했죠

translation.ko: 혼수상태에 빠진 후 다시는 회복하지 못하죠

translation.ko: 에후드 올메르트가 이끄는 카디마당은 손쉽게 승리하고

he's back at the highest ranks of government.

translation.ko: 옛 친구들을 포함한 다른 이들은 노동당을 저버렸다고 비판합니다

translation.en: June 2007.

translation.ko: 카차브 대통령은 강간과 성희롱 혐으로 사임합니다

translation.ko: 즉시 시몬 페레스가 가장 사리에 맞는

translation.ko: 부모님 댁에서 안식일 저녁 식사를 함께했는데

translation.ko: 첫 대통령 선거 때 있었던 일을 너무 생생하게 기억하고 있었죠

translation.ko: 소냐는 시몬이 자리를 거절하고 은퇴하길 바라죠

translation.ko: 페레스는 대통령 후보로 한 번 더 나서기로 합니다

translation.ko: 제가 그랬죠 '소냐, 나 좋자고 하는 거 아냐'

as long as I can serve, you must understand."
translation.ko: '내가 봉사할 수 있는 한 당신이 이해를 해줘야 해'

translation.ko: 소냐는 대통령 관저에 안 가고 싶어 했어요

translation.ko: 소냐는 집에 있는 시몬의 물건을 다 가져가라고 했죠, 책도요

translation.ko: 소냐는 집에 있는 시몬의 물건을 다 가져가라고 했죠, 책도요 시몬은 소냐와 함께하고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: He sent her all kind of messages in interviews he gave to the papers.
translation.ko: 신문 인터뷰 등을 통해 온갖 이야기를 다 전했죠

translation.en: That was very, very sad.
They were two people who really loved each other very deeply,
translation.ko: 두 사람은 정말로 서로를 깊이 사랑했거든요

translation.en: even when they were separated.
[narrator] The Presidency, since Israel's founding, has largely been a ceremonial position.
translation.ko: 이스라엘 건국 이래 대통령 자리는 대개 의전용이었죠

translation.en: Shimon Peres decides to revitalize and redefine the office.
translation.ko: 시몬 페레스는 그 자리에 활력을 불어넣고 재정의하기로 마음먹죠

translation.en: [Bar-Zohar] He went all over the world and he was the symbol of Israel
translation.ko: 그는 전 세계를 다녔어요 이스라엘의 상징이자

translation.en: and the symbol of maturity, of moderation, of vision,
of fighting for peace.
He became the president of everybody.

Hitler's place.

translation.ko: 할아버지에 대한 애기를 하고 나서 카디시 기도문을 읊었죠

the moral and historic answer

translation.ko: 말살하려고 한 시도에 대한 도덕적, 역사적 응답이기 때문이죠

translation.en: Jewish history continues to move forward on two parallel tracks:
translation.ko: 유대인의 역사는 2개의 나란히 놓인 길을 따라 지속됐죠

translation.en: The moral track, encapsulated in the Ten Commandments.
The document which was written some three thousand years ago.
And the scientific track, which unravels hidden secrets
translation.ko: 또 과학의 길은 과거 인간의 눈으로는 보이지 않던

translation.en: concealed in the past from the eyes of men,
and which, unraveled, change our lives.
I started with the memorial prayer
and will end with Israel's national anthem.
Our hope is not lost. The hope of 2,000 years...
translation.ko: 우리는 희망을 잃지 않는다 2천 년의 희망을

translation.en: to be free people in our land, land of Zion and Jerusalem.
Thank you all.
[Bar-Zohar] Only Shimon could do it. Nobody else.
translation.ko: 시몬 만이 할 수 있었죠 아무도 그렇게 못 해요

translation.en: [narrator] President Shimon Peres also becomes
one of the most trusted statesmen on the international arena.
translation.ko: 국제 정치 무대에서도 가장 신뢰받는 정치가 중 하나였죠

translation.en: Leaders from all around the world

translation.ko: 어떻게 해서든 그를 찾아 조언과 자문을 구했죠

translation.ko: 리더십이란 더 나은 미래를 향한 것어어야 한다고 생각합니다

translation.ko: 하지만 지도자는 또한 지평선 너머를 볼 수 있어야 하고

translation.en: and think strategically on behalf of people.
Shimon Peres certainly did.
And I spent a lot of time talking to him about his view
translation.ko: 그 지역이 평화롭게 성장하도록 도울 방법에 대한

translation.en: of how to help the region grow peacefully,
translation.ko: 시몬의 관점을 두고 오랜 시간 이야기를 나눴고

translation.en: and I believe ultimately that'll happen.
[man 1] Shimon was a model for me in many ways,
translation.ko: 시몬은 제게 여러 가지로 모범이 되는 분이었지만

translation.en: but most particularly, because of the spirit that he brought to politics,

When I left office and became involved
translation.ko: 제가 총리에서 물러나고 중동 지역의 정치와

translation.ko: 시몬은 제가 자문을 많이 구했던 분이었고

translation.ko: 제게 희망을 주신 분이기도 했죠, 결국에는요

translation.ko: 시몬의 업적은 그가 끝까지 이스라엘과 이웃 나라가

translation.ko: 희망과 믿음을 잃지 않았기 때문에 가능한 것이었습니다

translation.en: [man 5] I was still a senator.

translation.ko: 당시에 저는 대통령이 될 수 있을지 확신하지 못했습니다

translation.en: When I was visiting Israel after I had won the nomination,
translation.ko: 대선 후보 지명전에서 승리한 후 이스라엘을 방문했을 때

translation.en: Shimon asked if we could have a little bit of time together.
The genuine interest he had taken in my campaign,
translation.ko: 제 선거 운동에 대해 순수한 관심을 보였죠

translation.en: the degree to which he expressed hope

translation.ko: 중동 지역에서도 똑같이 이뤄질 수 있으면

and flattering moment for me.

translation.ko: 우리의 가장 강력한 동맹이자 가장 가까운 친구는

And no individual has done so much over so many years
translation.ko: 가장 오랜 시간 동안 우리의 동맹을 돈독히 하고

translation.en: to build our alliance and to bring our two nations closer

translation.ko: 시몬 페레스는 소냐가 평화롭게 숨을 거두었다는 소식을 듣죠

translation.ko: 깊은 슬픔 속에 급히 텔아비브로 가서 자식들, 손주들과 함께하죠
